column5: Here's a good pike recipe and article for your winter reading....http://northernontario.travel/fishin...n-ontario-pike

I have watched about nine videos showing how to fillet pike and I have now seen nine different methods. You guys always make it look so easy. I don't fillet a lot of them, but I've gotten so I can get a nice boneless fillet, it just takes me awhile. I like the way you removed the ribs. I'll try it that way this season.

I really enjoy fresh Pike. Eat some every trip! I've tried filleting a few different ways, but prefer how it was done in that video for the size of fish I keep anyway. Of course, I am not as talented and always forget which direction the Y-bones go!
A nice fresh pike is good eating. I can deal with the bones but I hate the slime.
